pullRequest.body:
We add some order properties (mainly some `lt`) for types of the form `WithZero α`.

Co-authored-by: María Inés de Frutos Fernández <midff@math.uni-bonn.de>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Int.ofAdd_neg_natCast_lt_one`
`+ instance [Nontrivial α] : Nontrivial (WithZero α)ˣ`
`+ lt_succ_iff_le`
`+ one_lt_div₀`
`+ zpow_left_injOn₀`
`+ zpow_left_inj₀`
`+ zpow_left_strictMonoOn₀`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
I find the imports increase somewhat worrying. Can you figure out what 29 files are being transitively imported that weren't before?

> I find the imports increase somewhat worrying. Can you figure out what 29 files are being transitively imported that weren't before?

They are triggered by these new imports in `Canonical`.
import Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Group.Int
import Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Monoid.Unbundled.Pow
import Mathlib.Data.Set.Monotone
import Mathlib.Order.Interval.Set.Defs
Yes, I understand. I am asking what exactly the 29 new *transitive* imports are. I currently only know 4 out of 29.

> Yes, I understand. I am asking what exactly the 29 new _transitive_ imports are. I currently only know 4 out of 29.

OK, I performed some tests. The only file that creates a huge gap is `import Mathlib.Data.Set.Monotone` (25 transtitive imports), whose content is unfortunately needed (i.e. : it is not imported simply because of the files it imports, so that we could reduce the imports). I also run ` min_imports`, and the one I have is the output. I do not know if there is anything else to do. FYI: that file only imports one file (`Data.Set.Functions)`, itself only importing two, so the cascade is later on.
@YaelDillies Do you have more thoughts on this?
I think the unnecessary imports are mostly coming from `Data.Set.Prod`. @Vierkantor, do you have ideas here?
Since your last two commits CI is not passing any more, can you please revert them? I can also do this, but since you had suggestions I do not want to loose them.

```suggestion
    Set.InjOn (fun x : WithZero α ↦ x ^ n) (Set.Ioi 0) := by
```

```suggestion
theorem zpow_strictMonoOn [LinearOrderedCommGroup α] {n : ℤ} (hn : 0 < n) :
```
(it's an exception to the usual naming convention)
Doesn't `mul_lt_mul_right` apply here?
Indeed!
Sorry, but why are you still adding this lemma then? Isn't it exactly a specialisation of `mul_lt_mul_right`? 😅
Oh sure, I just implemented your suggestion without thinking what it meant... 🤭

nit:
```suggestion
  (zpow_left_injOn hn).eq_iff ha.bot_lt hb.bot_lt
```

```suggestion
```

This statement looks really convoluted. What about something like
```suggestion
theorem lt_succ_iff_le {x : ℤₘ₀} {m : Multiplicative ℤ} : x < m * ofAdd (1 : ℤ) ↔ x ≤ m := by
```
Nice!
Where is this one gone?

To this file
Mathlib/Algebra/Order/Monoid/Unbundled/Pow.lean
where it is stated in a slightly greater generality: see
https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/f74a9e71f93ec0a80b5ea8c948681f5bb40fa607/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/Monoid/Unbundled/Pow.lean#L320
Ah, right! Sorry for the noise
I think the answer here is that `Mathlib.Algebra.Equiv.TransferInstance` is a silly file that should be split
I agree, but splitting that one is beyond the scope of this PR, I guess. I think the small comment is still relevant, but if you object against, I can remove it.
I do think it doesn't add much value

```suggestion
theorem one_lt_zpow {x : G} (hg : 1 < g) {n : ℤ} (hn : 0 < n) : 1 < x ^ n := by
```
to match the rest of the file

```suggestion
  unitsWithZeroEquiv.toEquiv.surjective.nontrivial
```

Sorry for breaking your code
```suggestion
theorem one_lt_zpow {x : G} (hx : 1 < x) {n : ℤ} (hn : 0 < n) : 1 < x ^ n := by
  lift n to ℕ using Int.le_of_lt hn
  rw [zpow_natCast]
  exact one_lt_pow' hx (Int.natCast_pos.mp hn).ne'
```

> Sorry for breaking your code

Well, you also fixed it again 😃

This lemma feelss overly specific. Can you either:
* drop it
* generalise it, maybe something like
```suggestion
theorem Int.ofAdd_neg_natCast_lt_one {n : ℕ} : (Multiplicative.ofAdd (-n : ℤ) : ℤₘ₀) < 1 := by
  rw [← coe_one, coe_lt_coe, ← ofAdd_zero, ofAdd_lt]
  omega
```
(didn't fix the proof)
Good point!

Can you generalise that to `GroupWithZero` + `LinearOrder` + compatibility typeclasses by assuming 
```suggestion
theorem one_lt_div' [LinearOrderedCommGroupWithZero α] (a : α) {b : α} (hb : 0 < b) :
    1 < a / b ↔ b < a := by
  rw [← mul_lt_mul_right (zero_lt_iff.mpr hb), one_mul, div_eq_mul_inv, inv_mul_cancel_right₀ hb]
```
This way it will also apply to eg linearly ordered fields. Same for the three lemmas below
I managed to generalise the first but the other two landed me in a typeclass nightmare... I'd stick to this one for the moment (but will have a look at the import after lunch).
This is in the `WithZero.Int` namespace. Is this expected?
And this one is in the `WithZero` namespace

pullRequest.title: feat: add order properties to WithZero types
